summary: Helen of Troy was a famous beauty in Greek mythology. She was the daughter of Zeus and married to King Menelaus of Sparta. Her abduction (or elopement) by Paris from Troy caused the Trojan War. Different stories say she was either sorry or happy about the war. After the war, she was either reunited with Menelaus or went to live with the gods. Helen was seen as a symbol of beauty, inspiring many artists.
title: Helen of Troy
